abstract.p: Cozy Friedman, owner of Cozy's Cuts for Kids in Manhattan, likes to dress for her day in jeans, cotton shrug and cowboy boots; photo (S)

block.p: With a name like Cozy, it's fitting that Cozy Friedman would become a symbol for the Manhattan stroller-pushing set. The owner of Cozy's Cuts for Kids, three popular uptown children's hair salons, Ms. Friedman provides legions of stylish Manhattan parents with that watershed moment: baby's first haircut.
Managing her salons, her line of children's hair-care products (So Cozy) and two grade-school-age boys, ''my life has many layers,'' Ms. Friedman said. Her wardrobe does too.

Managing her salons, her line of children's hair-care products (So Cozy) and two grade-school-age boys, ''my life has many layers,'' Ms. Friedman said. Her wardrobe does too.

''I leave early in the morning and come home late. On any given day I'll go running at 5:45 a.m., shower, go on a sales call, have a business lunch, pick up the kids from soccer and go out to dinner. So I dress for an entire day.''

Here in the spirit of always being prepared Ms. Friedman, 40, wears a pair of Gold Sign jeans, which she prizes for being neither too high-waisted nor too low-waisted; a celery silk camisole by Gold Hawk; a hand-painted burgundy shrug by Flamingo Therapy; and Justin cowboy boots that give her comfort for day and height for night.

''I like designers I've never heard of before,'' she said. ''I love finding offbeat stores. Tonight I'm going to dinner downtown, so I'll try to get there early and do a quick shop. You have to squeeze in a little shopping whenever you can.''
